html: The Queen to her son tonight: “It is a privilege for any mother to be able to propose a toast to her son on his 70th birthday. It means that you have lived long enough to see your child grow up. It is rather like ... planting a tree and being able to watch it grow." #Charlesat70
text:
The Queen to her son tonight:
“It is a privilege for any mother to be able to propose a toast to her son on his 70th birthday. It means that you have lived long enough to see your child grow up. It is rather like ... planting a tree and being able to watch it grow." #Charlesat70

html: Consultation opens today on the Community Infrastructure Levy (CIL) we are planning to introduce. A CIL is a charge on developments to help fund the cost of providing infrastructure to support the growth of the two districts. To take part please go to http://www.chiltern.gov.uk/CILconsultation2018 …
text:
Consultation opens today on the Community Infrastructure Levy (CIL) we are planning to introduce.

A CIL is a charge on developments to help fund the cost of providing infrastructure to support the growth of the two districts.

To take part please go to http://www.chiltern.gov.uk/CILconsultation2018 …

html: IMPORTANT NOTICE: The government will abolish @buckscc & all Bucks District Councils & replace them with 1 new unitary council. Services which are currently split between County & District councils will all be brought under the new council, which is expected to open in 2020.pic.twitter.com/WuvQLXnXgU
text:
IMPORTANT NOTICE: The government will abolish @buckscc & all Bucks District Councils & replace them with 1 new unitary council.

Services which are currently split between County & District councils will all be brought under the new council, which is expected to open in 2020.pic.twitter.com/WuvQLXnXgU

html: Our balanced approach to the economy is working: Unemployment continues to fall. Wages are rising faster than prices.  Youth unemployment lowest since records began. https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-45875599?fbclid=IwAR15tNWRuaqv5hE7iAcpxhHVuYERG3zNLgPlwHnNV5NnuYqwqMPr4zlnW-w …
text:
Our balanced approach to the economy is working:

 Unemployment continues to fall.

text:
New jobs figures released today from the @ONS show that in the past year:

The number of people in work has reached a record high.
Unemployment is at its lowest since 1975.
Wages are rising faster than prices.pic.twitter.com/FPVBAwWVmE

html: Absolutely. Like the Ver the Misbourne suffers from combined impacts of abstraction, transfer of wastewater out of catchment for treatment & of course, climate change. Abstraction is scheduled to be reduced at Amersham this year, Don't know if @affinitywater have done this yet.

html: .@CherylGillan highlights the need for all mental health staff to understand autism and receive training. She says it should be emphasised more in Transforming Care.

html: She now moves on to accountability. At a national policy level, autistic people's needs can fall through the gaps. What steps is the Minister taking to ensure the NHS meets the needs of autistic people, @CherylGillan asks.pic.twitter.com/1EJ9uAMQNX

html: Good news this week: - Employment income rising at fastest rate in 10 yrs - Manufacturing surged with orders increased to +13% - Deficit at lowest since 2001/02 - Borrowing lowest since 2005 - Income inequality continuing to fall
text:
Good news this week:

- Employment income rising at fastest rate in 10 yrs 

- Manufacturing surged with orders increased to +13% 

- Deficit at lowest since 2001/02 

- Borrowing lowest since 2005 

- Income inequality continuing to fall

html: Today we’re setting out details of how our settled status scheme for EU citizens - who contribute so much to our country - will work. I also want to see Member States set out how they will support British citizens living in their countries. They’re taking far too long.

Today we’re setting out details of how our settled status scheme for EU citizens - who contribute so much to our country - will work. 

I also want to see Member States set out how they will support British citizens living in their countries. They’re taking far too long.

html: ‘Upskirting’ is a hideous invasion of privacy which leaves victims feeling degraded and distressed. Whilst we are disappointed this Bill did not pass second reading today, we look forward to supporting these measures through the House at the earliest possible opportunity.

html: Do you know what’s happening in Greece? Over 2000 cases of measles with 2 fatalities. If you are going there on holiday this summer, make sure your child has had 2 doses of the MMR vaccine! Call the Bucks Immunisation Team on 01296 566063 to arrange a catch up appointment.

html: UK goods & services are in demand, @ONS figures today show. Total UK exports £625.9bn - a rise of 11.5% in the year to January, helping to narrow the trade deficit by £12.8bn. In this time: goods exports rose by 12.6% to £344.5bn services exports rose by 10.1% to £281.4bn
text:
UK goods & services are in demand, @ONS figures today show. Total UK exports £625.9bn - a rise of 11.5% in the year to January, helping to narrow the trade deficit by £12.8bn.
In this time:
goods exports rose by 12.6% to £344.5bn
services exports rose by 10.1% to £281.4bn
